intro: Bowlesia tenera, commonly known as the slender bowlesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bowlesia tenera thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
